result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald W Skopec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald W Skopec is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald W Skopec was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald W Skopec

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donald W Skopec not in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Donald W Skopec. 
Victim rights have been complied with. State moves to amend count 2 to 9.01. Court grants amendment. Attorney Sutton enters no contest plea. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty and orders a $267.50 forfeiture with 60 days to pay or payment plan, the forfeiture amount is inclusive of costs.  
Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed.  Repay $100.00 per month starting 04/01/2022.

10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Donald W Skopec appeared by video, Attorney Laura Ann Sutton for Donald W Skopec appeared by video.
Reading of Complaint waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Next hearing may be by zoom.  Address and phone number confirmed.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
and Order.  Granted.  Attorney Laura Sutton appointed.  Must repay $100.00 per month starting 04/01/2022.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must  have no contact with K.M.S. dob 3/11/1964

12:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Donald W Skopec appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow (for today only) appeared by video for Donald W Skopec. 

Court quashes warrant.
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 
AIA set; must appear in person
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
